intro: Galium rifanum var. flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green bedstraw, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit, with slender, hairy stems that often root at the nodes. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a distinctive yellow-green coloration. Small, white or pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. This variant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
